page.title: 07RECREATION
page.content: {The Whitegate Way-WHITEGATE. The Whitegate Way is a public footpath running on the route of a disused railway. The railway ran from Cuddington. The footpath is six miles long.In the future this walk will link up with the Wirral Country Park, the Sandstone Trail in the Peckforton Hills and the Gritstone Way in Macclesfield. This will make a long distance footpath across Cheshire. The Whitegate Way is very busy at the weekend. People come to walk and jog and to exercise their dogs and horses. There is a wide variety of wildlife including badgers, foxes, squirrels and rabbits and many less common birds such as yellowhammers, siskins and kingfishers.Mr.McGeagh and Mr.Oulton are the Whitegate Rangers, responsible for the day to day running and maintenance along the walk.
